Summary: Green Fireball sighting at the edge of Stanley Park in Vancouver BC Canada
divs: sighting detailsi observed what looked like a green fireball shoot like a rocket horizontally parallel to the ground about 10 metres high off the ground. it lasted about 3 seconds and disappeared, there was no noise. it was 8 pm - still broad daylight and i was walking out of stanley park - there were a few cars driving by but i'm not sure whether they noticed anything - it was very fast. it seemed like such a natural thing to see that i first thought it was a shooting star. my second thought was that shooting stars cannot be seen in daylight and not so low to the ground and certainly not neon green! i didn't think about it again till today when i found a note in wikipedia about green fireballs http:\\en.wikipedia.org\wiki\green_fireballs i'm still not certain what i saw can be described as a fireball but it was rocketing green neon ball of light that disappeared into nothing - quite low to the ground.
trends: There have been 33 other sightings in Vancouver
There were no other sightings in Vancouver on or around August 1st 2013
